definitions.consumer prices index: means the all items consumer prices index published by the Statistics Board
definitions.relevant power: means the power in section 9(2) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012, or the power in section 150(2)(b) of the Social Security Administration Act 1992
definitions.standard allowance: means the allowance to be included in an award of universal credit under section 9(1) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012
definitions.tax year: means the 12 months beginning with 6 April in any year

obligations.Secretary of State: must exercise a relevant power in order to secure that the amounts of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are at least the amounts calculated for each tax year in accordance with specified steps
obligations.Department for Communities in Northern I: must exercise a relevant power in order to secure that the amounts of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are at least the amounts calculated for each tax year

responsibilities.Secretary of State: must exercise powers to increase the protected LCWRA amount or any standard allowance amount for specific tax years to achieve certain financial outcomes for claimants
responsibilities.Department for Communities in Northern I: must exercise powers to increase the protected LCWRA amount or amounts of the standard allowance for tax years as necessary

eligibility.pre-2026 claimant: must have been entitled at any time before 6 April 2026 to an award of universal credit that included the LCWRA element and has been entitled continuously since then
eligibility.severe conditions criteria claimant: must have a determination based on assessment indicating severe conditions criteria applying to them

payments.standard allowance: amounts calculated by specific steps involving previous tax years and CPI adjustments as outlined in the provisions
payments.LCWRA element: amounts explicitly defined for claimants with limited capability for work and related conditions

penalties.non-compliance: subsections of section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act do not apply for specified tax years regarding annual up-rating of certain benefits like LCWRA and LCW elements

record_keeping.assessment periods: must be documented in accordance with provisions and have the same meaning as in the references of the relevant Acts
